html:
Investors have lost at least 15% in four stocks from the Tata stable in 2024, with the highest price erosion seen in midcap Tata Technologies. Its bluechip counter Tata Consumer Products along with Tata Elxsi and Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra) are other major laggards.

Tata Technologies, whose stock was listed with much fanfare in 2023 and became a multibagger (180% gains) on debut, is down by 23% this year, and 26% from its peak of Rs 1,217.95.

Tata Tech provides end-to-end product development across automotive, aerospace and industrial heavy machinery among other sectors. It was the first Tata company to be listed in nearly two decades.

The next biggest fall is seen in Tata Elxsi, which has plunged 22% in 2024 so far. The design and technology services company has seen its share fall by 24% from its 52-week peak.

Largecap counter Tata Consumer Products is down by over 15% in 2024 YTD and so is Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra), a smallcap stock associated with the group. While the Tata Consumer shares are down by 28% from their 52-week peak, Tata Teleservices has corrected 32% from the top.

Tata Consumer is also among the top 100 wealth creators with a price CAGR of 40% between 2019 and 2014 according to a Motilal Oswal report titled ‘29th Annual Wealth Creation Study, 2024’. A five-year price CAGR of 62% puts Trent as the top wealth creator among the bluechip counters in the pack. Tata Motors, Tata Consumer and Tata Power are next in line with CAGR of 42, 40% and 40%, respectively.

Also Read: Tata Motors, Trent, 5 more bluechip stocks from Tata stable fall up to 23% in 3 months. What should you do?

The correction in these stocks coincides with the weakness in the overall markets. In the last three months, Nifty has declined by over 8%.

Moreover, Tata Technologies' weak earnings may have also had an impact on the stock price performance. The company reported consolidated September quarter revenue of Rs 809 crore, down 22.4% YoY, while the net profit plunged 72% YoY. Meanwhile, Tata Teleservices reported a loss of Rs 330 crore in the July-September quarter.

As for Tata Consumer and Tata Elxsi, the numbers were decent with net profit growth at 8% and 15%, respectively.

Should you bet?

Tata Consumer is a top buy of multiple brokerages, including Motilal Oswal, Securities and Centrum Broking's Nilesh Jain, who is Head Vice President, Equity Research Technical and Derivatives.

Expert Sudeep Shah decodes the chart structure for each of these stocks. Among the four, he recommends a buy on Tata Consumer above Rs 925. This is what the Deputy Vice President & Head of Technical and Derivative Research Desk at SBI Securities said:

Tata Consumer

Tata Consumer is currently in a downtrend amid intensive selling pressure in FMCG counters. It is also trading below its key short and long moving averages and the RSI is below the 40 mark, indicating bearishness. The level of 870 is likely to be the immediate support, breaching which, we can see the price drop to 830 levels in the short term.

TTML

The price failed to sustain above its previous swing high of 85.50 made on November 27 and experienced profit booking for the last 10 trading sessions. The stock needs to give a strong breakout above the 86-88 levels for the up move to pick pace. The level of 69 will act as an immediate support for the stock.

Tata Elxsi

The stock gave a breakdown from its consolidation range of Rs 7,223-7,469 on December 20 and has seen follow up selling since then. The support for the stock is placed at Rs 6,604. While a breakout above its current resistance Rs 7,469) can trigger a fresh upmove in the stock.

Tata Tech

The stock is in a downtrend and hit a fresh low of Rs 883 on December 23. A break below the Rs 883 level can lead to the continuation of the selling pressure in the stock. It is advisable to avoid long positions in this counter until visible signs of trend reversal emerge.

Tata’s other 2024 laggards

Apart from the above four, eight other stocks have underperformed Nifty on a YTD basis. In this, Artson (5.72%) and Tata Steel (0.61%) have managed positive returns while Tata Communications, Tata Chemicals, Tata Motors, Tayo Rolls, Benares Hotels and Titan Company have fallen between 2.75% and 8.70%.

The combined market capitalisation of all listed Tata group companies has risen by Rs 3.55 lakh crore in 2024 to Rs 31.43 lakh crore on December 26, versus Rs 27.88 lakh crore at the end of 2023.
